intro: Syngonanthus venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan thimbleweed, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, berry-like fruits that contain the seeds. Syngonanthus venezuelensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
